document_data.name: ''Elixir of Half-Orcish Fury''
document_data.creator: [[Araj Oblodra]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Elixirs of half-orcish fury''''' were [[potion]]s created through sanguinous magic arts by [[Araj Oblodra]] of [[Crimson Draughts]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Powers: ''Elixirs of half-orcish fury'' were distilled from the blood of [[half-orc]]s, allowing the imbiber to adopt their racial abilities and properties. Once such a potion was consumed, it gifted the imbiber with ''half-orcish fury'' – the ability to be relentless in battle and remain standing even after suffering the gravest of injuries. This blood-bound magic was expended after one day.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Araj Oblodra, an [[alchemist]] and a Blood Vendor, was using the blood of half-orcs infected with the [[illithid]] tadpoles of the [[Cult of the Absolute]] to craft these potions during her stay with the cult in [[Moonrise Towers]]. After the death of [[Ketheric Thorm]], she returned to the Crimson Draughts – her apothecary in the city of [[Baldur's Gate]], where she resumed her sanguinous magic experiments.
